24
25#include <config.h>
26
27#include <inttypes.h>
28
29/*
30 * This is xoshiro128** 1.0, our 32-bit all-purpose, rock-solid generator.
31 * It has excellent (sub-ns) speed, a state size (128 bits) that is large
32 * enough for mild parallelism, and it passes all tests we are aware of.
33 *
34 * For generating just single-precision (i.e., 32-bit) floating-point
35 * numbers, xoshiro128+ is even faster.
36 *
37 * The state must be seeded so that it is not everywhere zero.
38 */
39#if defined(HAVE_TLS)
40#define _LOCK() {};
41#define _UNLOCK() {};
42
43#if defined(HAVE_THREAD_LOCAL)
44#include <threads.h>
45static thread_local uint32_t seed[4];
46#elif defined(HAVE___THREAD)
47static __thread uint32_t seed[4];
48#elif defined(HAVE___DECLSPEC_THREAD)
49static __declspec( thread ) uint32_t seed[4];
50#else
51#error "Unknown method for defining a TLS variable!"
52#endif
53
54#else
55#if defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64)
56#include <windows.h>
57static volatile HANDLE _mutex = NULL;
58
59/*
60 * Initialize the mutex on the first lock attempt. On collision, each thread
61 * will attempt to allocate a mutex and compare-and-swap it into place as the
62 * global mutex. On failure to swap in the global mutex, the mutex is closed.
63 */
64#define _LOCK() \
65 do { \
66 if (!_mutex) { \
67 HANDLE p = CreateMutex(NULL, FALSE, NULL); \
68 if (InterlockedCompareExchangePointer \
69 ((void **)&_mutex, (void *)p, NULL)) { \
70 CloseHandle(p); \
71 } \
72 } \
73 WaitForSingleObject(_mutex, INFINITE); \
74 } while (0)
75
76#define _UNLOCK() ReleaseMutex(_mutex)
77
78#else /* defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64) */
79
80#include <pthread.h>
81static pthread_mutex_t _mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
82#define _LOCK() RUNTIME_CHECK(pthread_mutex_lock(&_mutex)==0)
83#define _UNLOCK() RUNTIME_CHECK(pthread_mutex_unlock(&_mutex)==0)
84#endif /* defined(_WIN32) || defined(_WIN64) */
85
86static uint32_t seed[4];
87
88#endif /* defined(HAVE_TLS) */
89
90static inline uint32_t rotl(const uint32_t x, int k) {
91 return (x << k) | (x >> (32 - k));
92}
93
94static inline uint32_t
95next(void) {
96 uint32_t result_starstar, t;
97
98 _LOCK();
99
100 result_starstar = rotl(seed[0] * 5, 7) * 9;
101 t = seed[1] << 9;
102
103 seed[2] ^= seed[0];
104 seed[3] ^= seed[1];
105 seed[1] ^= seed[2];
106 seed[0] ^= seed[3];
107
108 seed[2] ^= t;
109
110 seed[3] = rotl(seed[3], 11);
111
112 _UNLOCK();
113
114 return (result_starstar);
115}
116
